Description:
In the era of precision oncology potential biomarkers to select individual tumors to match patients to receive targeted therapies are rapidly emerging. Some biomarkers have been validated to enable targeted interventions (i.e. EGFR mutations in Non Small Cell Lung Cancer patients) and other are currently undergoing validation.

Biomarker-discovery in radiation oncology is also ongoing, to enable better sequencing with systemic therapy, dose de-escalation or intensification. Elucidation of distinct mechanisms of cancer immune-evasion are also generating markers to best harness the immunogenicity of ionizing radiation. This session will introduce some of the ongoing work on biomarkers for precision radiation oncology.
SearchResultBody: SY28. Predictive Biomarkers for Precision Radiation Oncology
Title: Predictive Biomarkers for Precision Radiation Oncology
